paulfazio wrote:

> I have a situation where I need to invoke JUnit on a Windows box but
> have it implemented on a Linux box. Currently I am able to do this
> thru an embedded Tomcat server on the Linux box, and the test seems
> to work well. I need to have the test class located on both boxes,
> although it seems the test class on the Windows box is merely for
> reference and the code inside the test methods is only implemented
> on the Linux side. What I'd like to do is run different code on the
> Windows side, so that once the Linux side's code has been run the
> Windows' side code can verify the results. Does anyone have any
> suggestions?

Yes. Use Cactus. I'm sure you can set it up with a Linux server and 
Windows client. I've never done it, but I'm sure it can be done.
-- 
J. B. Rainsberger,
